sub_title: Professor at Amsterdam UMC, director at CLHC, CSO at FTS
summary:
Maurice Aalders graduated in 1996 at the Free University of Amsterdam and gained his PhD at the University of Amsterdam (UvA)  in 2001 on a thesis entitled: Aspects of Photodetection in Cervical and Ovarian Neoplasia.  

He worked as a physicist and staff member at the Laser Centre of the Academic Medical Centre (AMC) and the Anthony van Leeuwenhoek Hospital, Netherlands Cancer Institute both in Amsterdam. Currently he is a physicist and staff member of the Department of Biomedical Engineering and Physics of the Academic Medical Centre.

Maurice Aalders is performing research at the edge of applied physics, medical practice and forensic science. Medical practice related research concerns among others clinical applications of Optical Coherence Tomography, fluorescence diagnostics and photodynamic therapy. In 2006 a KNAW grant was scored on synthesis and spectroscopic studies of luminescence up-conversion nanoparticles doped with rare earth ions and their application in the diagnosis and therapy of cancer.

His  2006 NWO/STW, Innovational Research Incentives Scheme (VIDI) grant marked the start of a group whose research is aimed at the implementation of innovative optical and other techniques in forensic investigations. Starting with a research line aiming to improve the determination of the age of inflicted bruises as part of  the diagnosis of child abuse, the forensic group now covers lines on the age determination of bloodstains, post-mortem time determination from body cooling and bloodstain pattern analysis. All research is carried out in strong collaboration with the NFI and Dutch Police.  The University of Amsterdam appointed Aalders ‘professor in Forensic Biophysics’ on November, 2012. 
In 2013, the Faculty of Science, the AMC and the NFI founded an institute for stimulating joint research, education and case work called the ‘Co van Ledden-Hulsebosch institute for forensic science’ which is coordinated by two directors; Prof A. van Asten and Prof M Aalders .

profile_positions.title: Professor by special appointment of Forensic Biophysics

profile_positions.description:
The Co van Ledden Hulsebosch Center (CLHC) is the interdisciplinary center of expertise for forensic scientific and medical research in Amsterdam.
The CLHC serves to bundle the forensic experience, knowledge and expertise of the University of Amsterdam's Faculty of Science, the Academic Medical Center (AMC-UvA) and the Netherlands Forensic Institute (NFI).

The CLHC aims to develop into the Netherlands' leading forensic research institute. The centre seeks to contribute to specially themed collaborations between researchers and those working in the field, supervise ongoing projects and define new projects and initiatives. Relevant scientific insights and research methods from the academic world will be made available for the purpose of forensic research in general and crime scene research in particular.
profile_positions.title: Co-Director

profile_positions.description:
Forensic Technical Solutions (FTS) specializes in the development of spectral (imaging) techniques for the crime scene.

With our new dedicated portable hyperspectral camera we are able to detect and identify blood at the scene and to determine the age of a bloodstain in a remote, non-destructive way.
